episodes.title: Dr Robyn Lynette: From Cult Survivor to Mental MacGyver
episodes.description:
"I wrote 110,000 words in 40 days because my healing demanded to be heard."
What if your entire identity was built on someone else’s story?

In this powerful, deeply personal episode, Steve Ramona welcomes back Dr. Robyn Lynette for a part two conversation that strips away pretense and dives straight into transformation. Dr. Robyn doesn't just tell a story. She embodies resilience. Born into a cult, forced into marriage with her cousin at 18, and later entangled with the cartel, her life reads like a novel—but it’s all heartbreakingly true. Through vivid moments of chaos and clarity, Dr. Robyn shares how she reclaimed her agency, rewrote her identity, and emerged as a rock of stability for high-level clients navigating their own personal hurricanes.

With fierce clarity and disarming warmth, she reveals the journey behind her viral memoir, I'd Like to Thank the Cartel for Getting Me Out of the Cult, and what it means to become the Mental MacGyver—someone who can guide others out of chaos but will never swim out to save someone unwilling to save themselves.

Whether you're facing your own storm or helping others weather theirs, this episode offers tangible insight into healing, identity, and the quiet strength of doing the next right thing. Steve's signature servant-hearted presence meets Dr. Robyn's emotional intelligence in an unforgettable exchange of purpose, power, and perspective.

P.S. The first three listeners to reach out to Dr. Robyn will receive a free copy of her book, personally gifted by Steve. It might just change your life.

Guest Bio

Dr. Robyn Lynette is a former cult member turned executive clarity coach, known affectionately by her clients as the "Mental MacGyver." After surviving extreme emotional, physical, and psychological trauma, she reclaimed her life and identity, earning three degrees in six years, including a doctorate. Today, she guides celebrities, founders, and executives through chaos with deep wisdom and clarity, helping them anchor back into themselves. Her memoir, I'd Like to Thank the Cartel for Getting Me Out of the Cult, is a testament to the power of self-agency and emotional healing.
